reviews.review_msg: Prof Bullock is an amazing teacher, her lectures are always super engaging and I love everything about how she structured/formatted this online course. I've taken two classes with her and always leave with my ideas being challenged in a good way. However, she supports generative AI and even incorporated it into course modules, which was unfortunate

This was a fully online course about law and sexuality. Each learning module was interesting. The grading criteria was easy to understand with 60% of your grade coming from discussion, quizzes and easy learning activities for each week. The class was interesting. Would recommend giving yourself a few days to complete each learning module.

Professor Bullock was definitely one of my favourite professors at SFU. Her lectures, assignments, and papers are straightforward and easy to complete! Definitely recommend for a GPA booster if you need it!

This was a 4th year seminar class on "Friendship". The class felt like a book club and Dr. Bullock facilitated the discussion. This was a small class (20 student) and the nature of the material meant a lot of personal sharing and our small group became quite close over the semester. If this course is offered again, I would highly recommend.

I took GSWS 320 Friendship as a Liberatory Politic with Nerida, and it was such an amazing experience. All the readings were well curated and Nerida was very good at facilitating a great classroom discussion environment. She is one of the most compassionate professor I have ever had and if you have the opportunity to take her class, YOU SHOULD!
Lectures were always interesting and relevant to what was happening in the news. Attendance and participation very important. Assignments were reasonable.
I found this professor to be thoughtful and engaging.  Very good.

Nerida leads such an engaging and thought-provoking class. Truly one of my favourite courses I took at SFU. She is very passionate and knowledgeable about critical studies of marriage and clearly wants her students to succeed. Would highly recommend!
This was the class I looked forward to attending each week. Lectures are interactive with lots of group discussions. Attendance was really important. She really cared about her students.

- The assignment criteria were unclear.
- The instructor was often passive-aggressive/cold.
- Points are deducted for reasons that don't seem fair
   |-> Aka, despite approving my topic choice initially, points were deducted for that topic upon submission....... :/
- The instructor often seems unsure about the content of her own lecture notes.

Lectures were super engaging and fun to listen to, Nerida made this course really interesting. Assignment criteria was clear, and exams were online multiple choice and open book long written questions. She was very kind and understanding, would definitely take a course with her again
